reviews.review_msg: First time teaching at sfu, her exams are like first year, lots of writing but straightforward easy questions.  She tends to reuse some of the practice exam questions.  Her strong russian accent is very hard to understand at first but you will get used to it. Studying for this course heavily relied on the sub-notes in the slides. Marking is fair.

lectures were great. we had to hand in HW every week, but they were very easy. The Avg for the final was a little low. Her notes are very complete u don't really need to read the textbook Very interesting course

MBB 420 Microbial Pathogenesis was a great course. I found Dr. Craig's section of the course easy to follow, and her quizzes are fair.  She does speak a bit fast, but if you ask, she will slow down and repeat things.  I like her emphasis on getting us to know the basic facts.

Great lecturer, very interested in material and knows what she is talking about.  Notes provided are a little too detailed, but the full notes are always given out.  She was helpful, friendly, and her overall attitude towards students was great.  She lectures a bit fast at times, but will slow down if/when asked to.
